Title: Don't fall asleep in the Glade
Credits: Program base Created by Adam Smith (amsmith@ucsc.edu). Story by Aslan Gilman

Somewhere.Body:
You find yourself lost.
The trees surrounding you are dark and looming. They slowly creak as a breeze whistles through the thin, leafless branches...

Where would you like to go?

Mansion.Body:
Over a hill and through the trees lays a Mansion bigger than you've ever seen.
The sky above it is gray, the peeling paint having shelter from the sun.
As you come closer, you see a figure in the upstairs window. You're aware of how loud your shoes crunch on the cold dirt.
It doesn't stir.
Maybe it hasn't seen you.

MansionInside.Body:
The door creaks open, unlocked, swinging on crooked hinges.
You're faced with a set of ornate wooden stairs. From somewhere above you hear piano music, quiet and melodic.
Do you follow the music?

MansionUp.Body:
The sweet sound of the piano entices you up the stairs. You push forward, slowly placing your foot on the first step.
Then the next.
Then the next.
a creak sounds out below you. The music stops.
a Man exits a door, you meet him face to face.

Help.Body:
You tell the man you are lost. He invites you downstairs for tea.
The two of you have much to talk about.

Choices.Text: The Man gives you a compass

Run.Body:
You turn and book it, down the creaking stairs...
out the back door of the house...
Through a field...
you stop to catch your breath.
Something whinnies.
You've found yourself in stables.

MansionOutside.Body:
out the back door of the house...
Through a field...
you stop to catch your breath.
Something whinnies.
You've found yourself in stables.

Horse.Body: A brown horse nuzzles your head

Horse2.Body: The horse is now your friend. You steal the horse and ride into the sunset.

LoggerHut.Body:
continuining on your journey, you enter into the heavily wooded forest.
the sky is darker here.
you try not to focus on the faces forming in the trees.
eventually you stumble upon a logger's mill next to a stream, a water wheel lazily turning over the rushing water.
you begin to feel cold. You should find some shelter.

LoggerHutInside.Body:
A man sharpening an axe sits by the fire. He tells you of the danger you may encounter.
you notice a log by your foot... in case you have to defend yourself.
Do you trust him?

LoggerHutAttack.Body: Everything happened so fast... his blood is still on your hands.

LoggerHutStay.Body:
You an the man talk for hours. He leaves you with a compass to find your way home.
You're welcome to stay the night and leave in the morning.

Home.Body:
With the help of the compass, these directs suddenly make sense. You find your way home in time for supper.
What a silly thing to have been afraid.
...However... you do wonder how you found yourself lost in the first place.

Beyond.Body: You wander farther into the woods... you feel you may be lost forever...
